hero.subtitle: Our Story
hero.title: About Light Tours
hero.description: {years} years of creating unforgettable travel experiences in the heart of the Turkish Riviera.

story.title: Our Story
story.p1: Light Tours began in 1988 as a small, family-run operation in Fethiye. What started as a passion for sharing the beauty of the Turkish coastline with visitors has grown into one of the region's most trusted travel agencies.
story.p2: Our founder's vision was simple: provide exceptional service, maintain the highest standards, and treat every guest like family. This philosophy has guided us for over three decades.
story.p3: Today, with a fleet of over 20 yachts and a team of dedicated professionals, we continue to create unforgettable experiences for travelers from around the world.

1988.title: The Beginning
1988.desc: Founded as a small family office in Fethiye, offering local boat tours.

1995.title: Fleet Expansion
1995.desc: Acquired our first gulet and began offering private yacht charters.

2002.title: TURSAB Certification
2002.desc: Received official travel agency license, expanding our service range.

2010.title: International Recognition
2010.desc: Started serving international clients from Europe and beyond.

2018.title: 30 Years Celebration
2018.desc: Celebrated three decades with a fleet of 20+ yachts.

2024.title: Digital Transformation
2024.desc: Launched AI-powered booking system for personalized travel planning.

hero.subtitle: Help Center
hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.description: Find answers to common questions about our services, bookings, and travel in Turkey.

questions.q: What's included in a yacht charter?
questions.a: Private charters include the yacht, crew (captain, cook, deckhands), all meals, fuel, port fees, water sports equipment, and bedding. Alcoholic beverages are typically extra.
No! Our yachts come with professional crew who handle all sailing. You're free to relax, swim, and enjoy the journey.

questions.q: What should I pack for a yacht trip?
questions.a: Pack light, casual clothing, swimwear, sunscreen, hat, and soft-soled shoes for the boat. We provide towels, snorkeling gear, and basic toiletries.
Absolutely! Private charters offer full flexibility. Discuss your preferences with us and we'll create a personalized route based on weather and your interests.

questions.q: What's the difference between cabin and yacht charter?
questions.a: Cabin charter means you book individual cabins and share the boat with other travelers. It's more affordable and a great way to meet people. Yacht charter is private - you rent the entire boat.

questions.q: Who will I share the boat with?
questions.a: Cabin charters typically host 8-16 guests from various countries. It's a social experience perfect for solo travelers or couples who enjoy meeting new people.

questions.q: Are meals included in cabin charter?
questions.a: Yes, all cabin charters are full-board including breakfast, lunch, and dinner prepared by our onboard chef. Special dietary requirements can be accommodated with advance notice.
All day tours include hotel pickup/drop-off, transportation, professional guide, entrance fees, and lunch (where specified). Check individual tour descriptions for specifics.

questions.q: What languages are tours available in?
questions.a: Our guides speak English, German, Russian, and Turkish. Other languages may be available on request with advance notice.
Most tours are family-friendly. Some activities like paragliding have age restrictions. Contact us for specific tour requirements.

questions.q: Do you track flights for airport transfers?
questions.a: Yes, we monitor all incoming flights. If your flight is delayed, your driver will adjust accordingly at no extra charge.

questions.q: What documents do I need to rent a car?
questions.a: You'll need a valid driving license (held for minimum 2 years), passport or ID, and a credit card for the security deposit. Minimum age is 21.

questions.q: Is insurance included with car rental?
questions.a: Yes, all rentals include comprehensive insurance (CDW) and third-party liability. Optional extras like GPS and child seats are available.

cta.title: Still Have Questions?
cta.subtitle: Our team is ready to help you with any questions about your upcoming trip.

blog.ctaDesc: Let us help you plan your perfect Turkish adventure.

content.intro: Fethiye, nestled along Turkey's stunning Turquoise Coast, offers something magical in every season. Whether you're seeking sun-drenched beaches, cultural exploration, or adventure activities, timing your visit right can make all the difference.

section1.heading: Spring (April - May)
paragraphs: Spring is arguably the best time to visit Fethiye for travelers who want to experience everything the region has to offer. The weather is warm but not scorching, typically ranging from 20-25°C (68-77°F).

Wildflowers blanket the hillsides, creating perfect conditions for hiking the Lycian Way. The sea begins to warm up enough for swimming by late May, and you'll find fewer crowds than in summer months.
This is also prime time for paragliding from Babadag Mountain, as thermals are excellent and visibility is outstanding.

section2.heading: Summer (June - August)
paragraphs: Summer is peak tourist season in Fethiye, with temperatures soaring to 35°C (95°F) or higher. The beaches are at their best, and the sea reaches perfect swimming temperatures.
Boat tours, including the famous 12 Islands cruise and Blue Lagoon excursions, run at full capacity. Nightlife comes alive, with bars and restaurants buzzing until late.
However, be prepared for higher prices, more crowded attractions, and the need to book accommodations and activities well in advance.

section3.heading: Autumn (September - November)
paragraphs: Autumn is our personal favorite for visiting Fethiye. September still offers warm beach days (28-30°C), but with significantly fewer tourists.
The sea remains warm enough for swimming well into October. This is an excellent time for yacht charters, as seas are calm and crowds have thinned.
Autumn also brings the olive and pomegranate harvest season, offering unique culinary experiences at local farms and restaurants.

section4.heading: Winter (December - March)
paragraphs: Winter in Fethiye is mild compared to much of Europe, with temperatures around 12-15°C (54-59°F). While swimming isn't advisable, it's perfect for cultural exploration.
Visit ancient sites like Kayakoy Ghost Village or Telmessos Rock Tombs without the summer crowds. Many hotels offer significant discounts.
Be aware that some boat tours and water activities may have limited availability during these months.

content.conclusion: The best time to visit Fethiye ultimately depends on your priorities. For the perfect balance of weather, activities, and value, we recommend late April to early June or September to mid-October. Whatever time you choose, the Turkish Riviera's natural beauty and warm hospitality will make your trip memorable.

content.intro: The 12 Islands boat tour is Fethiye's most iconic day trip, taking you through crystal-clear waters to some of the most beautiful islands and bays along the Turkish coast. Here's everything you need to know before you go.

section1.heading: What to Expect
paragraphs: Despite its name, the 12 Islands tour typically visits 5-6 stops, including secluded bays, swimming spots, and historic sites. The exact itinerary varies by operator and weather conditions.
Tours depart from Fethiye harbor around 10:00 AM and return by 6:00 PM. You'll spend time swimming, snorkeling, and exploring each stop.
Most tours include lunch on board (fresh grilled fish is a highlight), unlimited soft drinks, and use of snorkeling equipment.

section2.heading: Must-See Stops
paragraphs: Flat Island (Yassica) offers calm, shallow waters perfect for families. The island's distinctive flat rock formation is a popular photo spot.
Tersane Island features the ruins of an Ottoman shipyard and a small beach. The combination of history and natural beauty makes it unique.
Aquarium Bay lives up to its name with incredibly clear water where you can see fish swimming beneath your boat.

section3.heading: Tips for the Best Experience
paragraphs: Book a smaller gulet rather than a large party boat if you prefer a more relaxed atmosphere. The experience is more intimate and stops are less crowded.
Bring reef-safe sunscreen, a hat, and water shoes for rocky beaches. Most boats provide towels, but bringing your own doesn't hurt.
The best months for this tour are May through October when seas are calmest and water is warmest.

content.conclusion: The 12 Islands tour offers the perfect introduction to the beauty of the Turkish Riviera. Whether you're snorkeling in crystal-clear bays or enjoying freshly grilled fish on deck, it's a day you won't forget. Contact us to book your adventure!

content.intro: Dreaming of sailing the Turkish coast but unsure whether to book a cabin on a shared blue cruise or charter an entire yacht? Both offer incredible experiences, but they cater to different travel styles and budgets. Let's break down the differences.

section1.heading: Blue Cruise (Cabin Charter)
paragraphs: A blue cruise means booking individual cabins on a gulet that's shared with other travelers. It's the more affordable option, typically ranging from €400-800 per person for a week.
You'll share meals, swimming stops, and deck space with 8-16 other guests. It's inherently social - perfect for solo travelers or couples who enjoy meeting new people.
Routes and schedules are fixed, departing on set dates. The most popular routes run between Fethiye and Olympos or Fethiye and Marmaris.

section2.heading: Private Yacht Charter
paragraphs: Chartering a private yacht means the entire boat is yours. You choose the route, the pace, and the activities. Prices start around €8,000-10,000 per week for a 4-6 cabin gulet.
Per person, this often works out more expensive, but for families or groups of friends, the value increases significantly. A group of 10 on a €15,000 charter pays €1,500 per person.
Flexibility is the biggest advantage. Want to stay longer at a beautiful bay? No problem. Prefer to skip a crowded port? Your captain will adjust.

section3.heading: Which Should You Choose?
paragraphs: Choose a blue cruise if: you're traveling solo or as a couple, you have a flexible budget, and you enjoy meeting fellow travelers.
Choose private charter if: you're traveling with family or friends, you value privacy and flexibility, or you're celebrating a special occasion.
Consider a compromise: some operators offer 'mini charters' where you can book the entire boat for 4-5 nights at a reduced rate.

content.conclusion: Both options offer unforgettable ways to experience the Turkish coast. Contact us to discuss which option best fits your travel style, and we'll help you find the perfect cruise.

sharing.title: 3. Information Sharing
sharing.content: We may share your information with third parties only as necessary to provide our services, including hotels, airlines, tour operators, and payment processors. We do not sell your personal information.

security.title: 4. Data Security
security.content: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure.

cookies.title: 6. Cookies
cookies.content: Our website uses cookies to enhance your browsing experience. See our Cookie Policy for more details.

contact.title: 7. Contact Us
contact.intro: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing or using Light Tours Travel Agency services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, please do not use our services.

booking.title: 2. Booking and Payment
items: A 30% deposit is required to confirm bookings
Full payment is due before the departure date
Prices are subject to change until booking is confirmed
All prices are in EUR unless otherwise stated

cancellation.title: 3. Cancellation Policy
items: 14+ days before departure: Full refund minus processing fees

insurance.title: 4. Travel Insurance
insurance.content: We strongly recommend purchasing comprehensive travel insurance that covers cancellation, medical expenses, and personal belongings. Light Tours is not responsible for losses not covered by insurance.

liability.title: 5. Liability
liability.content: Light Tours acts as an agent for transportation, accommodation, and activity providers. We are not liable for injury, damage, loss, or delay caused by these third parties, weather conditions, or circumstances beyond our control.

yachtTerms.title: 6. Yacht Charter Terms
items: Guests must follow captain's safety instructions
Itinerary may change due to weather conditions

carTerms.title: 7. Car Rental Terms
items: Minimum age: 21 years with 2+ years driving experience
Valid driving license and credit card required

changes.title: 8. Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of our services constitutes acceptance of updated terms.

what.title: What Are Cookies?
what.content: Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit our website. They help us provide a better browsing experience and understand how you use our site.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.content: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable basic features like page navigation and access to secure areas.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.content: We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors interact with our website. This helps us improve our content and user experience.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.content: These cookies track your online activity to help us deliver more relevant advertising. They may be set by our advertising partners.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.content: These cookies remember your preferences (like language) to provide enhanced features.

managing.title: Managing Cookies
managing.intro: You can control cookies through your browser settings:
browsers: Chrome: Settings > Privacy and Security > Cookies
managing.note: Note: Disabling cookies may affect your experience on our website.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.intro: Our website may contain cookies from third-party services including:

updates.title: Updates to This Policy
updates.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. The latest version will always be available on this page.
